section.para: To create a new component item for the breeder bill of materials (BOM), select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Add New Breeder Bill of Materials Component Item

section.para: When creating a new component item for a breeder BOM, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the item number of the component item you want to add to the breeder BOM. The lookup feature located to the right of the field leads to a Co-Products and By-Products master list. The list includes all items whose item type is defined as either co-product or by-product.
Per: Specify the quantity of the component item required per breeder BOM. This is a required field.

listitem.para: Specify the percentage amount of cost absorption each co-product will assume. A co-product's cost is tied directly to the absorption percentage defined here. Co-product costs should not be entered manually. Instead, they should be derived by the system when cost updates are run. The following formula illustrates how the system determines co-product costs. Based on this example, you can see how the absorption percentage is used.

informalequation.mathphrase: Absorption % x Total Breeder Item Cost / Co-Product Qty. Per on Breeder BOM

note.para: As a rule, the system does not generate costs for by-products. However, you may choose to assign user-defined costing elements to by-products. Any manual by-product costs will be factored into the costing for co-products.

listitem.para: When implemented, this option will alert material requirements planning (MRP) that the parent breeder item should be called for when a need arises for the specified co-product. This option will only be available for breeder items which are co-products.
